hero.title: Our History
hero.subtitle: From Planned Settlement to Cone South Capital

home.explore_p1: Discover the beauty and attractions of Navira√≠, a city rich in culture, nature, and hospitality. From lush parks to vibrant events, there is something for everyone to enjoy.
home.explore_p2_trans: Navira√≠ is located in the southeast region of the state, being considered an important regional agro-industrial and service hub, known as the <1>Capital of the Conesul</1>.
home.explore_p3: Founded in 1952, the city has a modern infrastructure and is the ideal starting point for exploring the region's tourist potential.

festa_junina.name: Festa Junina
festa_junina.description: Traditional celebration with typical food, square dancing, and lots of fun.

music_festival.name: Music Festival
music_festival.description: Performances by local and national bands in an unmissable event for music lovers.

craft_fair.name: Craft Fair
craft_fair.description: Exhibition and sale of handmade products by talented artisans from the region.

hero.title: Our History
hero.subtitle: From a Planned Town to the Capital of the Conesul

introduction.title: Navira√≠
introduction.subtitle: The March to the West
introduction.p1: The history of Navira√≠ is an exemplary study of the interiorization policies known as the "March to the West". Unlike many spontaneous settlements, Navira√≠ was not born by chance.
introduction.p2: The municipality was conceived in a planned manner in 1952 by the <1>Colonizadora Vera Cruz</1>, with a peculiar urban layout in the shape of a "spider web", reflecting a high degree of organization and anticipation of growth.
introduction.p3: Strategically located in the Paran√° River Basin, the city was born isolated, depending on river transport on the Amambai River, until the first roads were opened, allowing for the transport of timber and the arrival of settlers.

pioneers.caption: The beginning of logging in the 1950s.
pioneers.title: The Pioneer Years (1952-1958)
pioneers.p1: The initial nucleus, named <1>Povoado Vera Cruz</1>, was driven by the sawmills installed in 1953. Figures like Moryoshi Fukuda and Ant√¥nio Augusto dos Santos were essential in this phase.
pioneers.p2: An important cultural milestone occurred in 1961, with the founding of the <1>Japanese Colony</1>, which brought 25 families who introduced vital agricultural techniques for the future of the region.

item1.title: Founding
item1.desc: Start of colonization by Vera Cruz Ltda.

item2.title: District
item2.desc: Elevated to a District by Law No. 1,195.

item3.title: Municipality
item3.desc: Emancipation via Law No. 1,944, by Weimar Torres.

item4.title: Installation
item4.desc: Inauguration of the 1st Mayor, Jo√£o Martins Cardoso.

card1.title: The Timber Cycle
card1.desc: Dominated by extraction and sawmills. It was the period of initial settlement and the opening of the first transport routes.

card2.title: Diversification
card2.desc: The 70s and 80s. Expansion of livestock farming and the peak of the cotton cycle, modernizing the agricultural base.

card3.title: Agro-industry
card3.desc: Post-1980 with Pro√°lcool, sugarcane mills, and more recently, high technology in soy and corn.

today.title: Navira√≠ Today
today.desc: Currently, Navira√≠ transcends its role as an agro-industrial hub. With robust infrastructure, such as the BR-163 highway, and investments in education and services, the city has consolidated itself as the regional support center, ensuring the sustainable development of the Cone-Sul of Mato Grosso do Sul.
